boardgame.name: League of Maidens
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





As a new threat emerges the Champions of the world fall and it is up to the legends of tomorrow to stand up and fight for mankind's survival.

League of Maidens® is a FREE TO PLAY online action RPG game that features beautiful maidens with guns and super powers by the 3-man indie studio Maiden Gaming. League of Maidens features a unique blend of 3rd person 360 degree land, sea and air movement with classic gun controls and action combat melee and super power mechanics. Not only can you battle it out on the battlefield or complete quests, CREATE. POSE. SHARE. QUEST. BATTLE mechanics allow players to spend 100s of hours in our in-depth character customization system, pose created characters with our free Pose3D (4K Photos) and Motion3D (Videos) tools as well as share created characters, poses, scenes and photos with fellow players across the world.

boardgame.name: Homebound
boardgame.description:
An Anthology of Games About Home and Going Away

From the back of the book:

Homebound collects three games I’ve written between 2017 and 2019 that explore themes of leaving and returning home. What makes a place a home, and a group of people a community? What happens when you leave, and when you return?

boardgame.name: The Lantern (Issue 1 - Feb 2021)
boardgame.description:
The Lantern
Issue One

A Four Against Darkness Zine

boardgame.name: Snakes in the Grass
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3-6.

The Pathfinder Society dispatches agents to attend a conference and secure agreements with the hobgoblin nation of Oprak. Travelling through dangerous terrain to reach their destination, the Pathfinders quickly discover a complication when they learn that the nefarious Aspis Consortium is also attending the talks. It’s all up to the Pathfinders to make a strong impression with the hobgoblins, all while foiling any attempts from Aspis to make inroads of their own.

boardgame.name: A Gilded Test
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-4.

Called to the city of Oppara, a group of Pathfinders quickly find themselves assigned to investigate a clandestine fighting tournament taking place in the city streets. However, there’s more to this tournament than meets the eye, and the PCs must quickly uncover the true motives behind those holding for these brutal bouts. Can the PCs learn the truth before they find themselves too caught-up in the event to escape?

boardgame.name: Lost In Flames
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3-6.

With a member of the Pathfinder Society’s leadership missing, the Society begins sending several groups of agents into the wilds for clues. To ensure the safety of the Pathfinders’ base camp in the distant lands of Iobaria, a group of heroes must uncover the truth behind what is happening around the ruins of a cyclops city, and begin putting a stop to a plan set in motion thousands of years ago!

This scenario features the Hexploration subsystem from the GameMastery Guide.

boardgame.name: Cleanup Duty
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Bounty designed for Level 1.

A time-displaced alchemist hires the PCs to clear out his former master's abode, which has become infested with oozes over the intervening millennia.

Written by: Elizabeth V Nold

Content sanctioned for use in the Pathfinder Society (second edition) Organized Play program.

boardgame.name: Clone Batch Catastrophe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-4.

When the Starfinder Society returns to the false moon of Salvation’s End, they discover a newly opened vault ripe for exploration. A group of Starfinders sent to delve this vault encounters a faulty system that produced clones of a single person to populate most of the vault. As their standard exploration mission devolves into absurdity, can the Starfinders uncover the source of the malfunction and save the vault’s residents before it’s too late?

boardgame.name: Secrets in Stillness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3-6.

After the tragic loss of one of his proteges, Radaszam the Dealmaker calls in a favor from some of his most trustworthy contacts. The Starfinders travel to Idari, the kasathan worldship, to investigate the mysterious death. There, the Starfinders follow a bloody trail left by a clever killer and, if they aren’t careful, risk becoming this enigmatic predator’s next prey.

boardgame.name: Toad of Holding
boardgame.description:
A Short Treatise on the Arean Toad as Monster, Wallet and Gate

Publisher's blurb:

The classical Bag of Holding is a way to ­sidestep or at least trivialize the ­trouble of having to choose between what to keep and what to leave ­behind. A hypermodern ­fantasy of non-friction, of docile invisible porters, of work without ­workers. Very well, but what if the bag in question was a grumpy, ­demanding toad?

Toad of Holding is a mini zine about the titular creature featuring two magic objects, three new monsters, a retainer type, a variant PC class and a short adventure location. Should work with any level based adventure games in the classic tradition.

boardgame.name: Vampyre Hearts: A Trick-Taking Game
boardgame.description: Raise the stakes on the classic game of Hearts in a bone-chilling twist to the trick-taking card game! With the Queen of Vampyres hiding amongst your number, her thirst for Hearts may send everyone to an early grave. Can you strike her down before time runs out? Housed in a gorgeous coffin-shaped box, this set includes a deck of unique illustrated playing cards and rules for standard Hearts play as well as expanded rules and a token for a vampyric variation that adds hidden roles and ulterior motives to the fast-paced classic. Prepare for a thrilling and bloodthirsty game night for new players and experts alike!

boardgame.name: Keep on Rowing - to the Edge of the World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You play as rowers that set on a journey towards [the] edge of the known world and enter into the underworld, it is not an easy path but you can find support and sustenance among your fellow rowers.
boardgame.rpg: Keep on Rowing - to the Edge of the World

boardgame.name: Ready or Not: The board game that could save your life.
boardgame.description:
What if the Red Cross joined with the creators of Trivial Pursuit and Dungeons & Dragons to make a family board game?

This game lets a family have fun while learning how to be safer. What would you do if you found ET or Casper the ghost in your home? Does everyone know how to turn the gas or power off to the home or what to do in case of an earthquake or tornado.

The game combines trivia questions with what if questions to see if the family knows what to do. Is the family Ready or Not in the Real World.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rise of the Round Table
boardgame.description:
King Arthur has taken the throne of England. As the Ladies and Lords of the Kingdom, you will need to help the kingdom prosper. The king gives you quests to build castles, raise forces to defend the kingdom, and expand the Economic base for your lands.
Can you rise to the challenge to bring greatness to Avalon, and by happenstance, your own lands?
A euro game at heart. Use the unique Rondel movement system to position pieces on the board, gather resources, and complete tasks given by King Arthur.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Adrift
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adrift is a game about human resilience in the face of overwhelming odds and almost certain death. It is a game about isolation, fear, and perseverance. You play a lone survivor of a terrible storm. The last moments as your yacht sank and the sharks moved in for the kill are still hazy, but the memories that do slowly return are not good. You did terrible things to survive, you have seen, your crew, your friends and family drown or ripped to shreds in clouds of red. You are dehydrated, exhausted and injured. Your fingernails are bleeding from gripping so hard to your raft. You can’t possibly survive this, can you?

boardgame.name: The Medium: a Marshall McLuhan Board Game
boardgame.description:
Inspired by legendary Canadian philosopher and innovative media thinker Marshall McLuhan (1911-1980), this board game gamifies Laws of Media. The New Science (1988), developed by Marshall McLuhan and his son Eric McLuhan (1942-2018). Also known as “McLuhans’ Tetrad”, the Laws of Media reveal the four constant rules that govern all human innovations, four questions that can be asked in order to understand the implications that will inevitably result from any medium.

An entertaining and educational board game that stimulates players’ cooperative, innovative, and creative thinking skills.

Educational and hilarious for the novice and expert alike, The Medium is fast-paced, engaging and brainy fun that will have young and old laughing... as they learn out loud.

This game is played in teams of two or more players. Each round, one team member tries to get their team to guess the medium on the card. Clues take the form of answers to the four questions of The Laws of Media. Teams move along the board when a medium is guessed correctly, pulling themselves out of the Maelstrom.

Use The Medium to analyze an artifact or human innovation from the past or present, and enjoy being the first team to escape the media maelstrom!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The Estate of Marshall McLuhan & the McLuhan Foundation

listing.notes: + shipment

boardgame.name: Vampire
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Vexatious Bureaucracy - Communist Vampires - Heartfelt Missives - Tacky Tourism

Publisher's blurb:

You have been contracted by Count Von Krendel to deliver a love letter to his paramour, The Lady Lilliana. She lives in the golden sphere of Bandrovia.

You raised concerns about whether you could stroll into a vampire’s castle unharmed, but the count didn’t really see why you thought that was a problem.

boardgame.name: A Few Degrees of Warming
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Few Degrees of Warming is a role playing game about a familiar city radically altered by climate change. Players will narrate the events of a coastal city as it struggles to overcome the many challenges presented by global warming.

User summary:

A Few Degrees of Warming is published as two PDF documents:

13-page game document
4-page card codex (reference)

boardgame.name: Captain's Log (Solo RPG)
boardgame.description:
Captain’s Log is a solo journaling RPG where you find yourself in the command of a ship, its crew embarking on a vast mission through space. The limits to this mission are defined by your imagination, and the stories you bring to life. Playing the Captain's Log is simple and offers hours of creative storytelling fun.

Captain's log has two modes:

Campaign

A 50 entry mission journaling adventure where you will be given the scenario outline of each log entry. Each of these entries will journal a mission, a day and event of note onboard your very own ship.

From there it's up to you to decide where the story goes and what twists and turns await the ship and its crew.

Scenario Generation

These are one off scenarios that can just be generated by simply using a 6 sided dice, or failing that the random number sheet located at the end of this RPG.

This system will see you generate a unique combination that becomes your scenario.

The system will give you:


A location
A Plot Event
A Subplot
Then as with the campaign the rest is up to you.


These can be played in single stand alone missions, or perhaps you want to chain them together and make another campaign to take your crew on.

The Kickstarter

boardgame.name: Crush!
boardgame.description:
Crush is about getting what you need to out in the open before being crushed by a kaiju.

It's two micro RPGs in one! The Single Player component is a solo journaling game and the Multiplayer can be played by 2 (or more) players. The physical rulebook is 16 interior pages, covering both games. The multiplayer game requires a tumbling wooden tower game and the solo requires a journal or notebook to collect your adventure as you write it.

boardgame.name: Cold War Combat: ACM
boardgame.description:
Cold War Combat is a miniature wargame based around the Cold War.
The initial entry in the series, Cold War Combat: ACM focuses on fighter jet combat.
The game features a streamlined ruleset that makes it easy for beginners to pick up and play, with additional advanced rules that can be applied to add layers of depth to the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Council's Deliberations Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Council cards expand the gameplay of Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) by allowing the defender to use the powers of the Pearl Keep's High Council.

In this expansion, the Council deliberates each round and makes decisions to bolster the Defender's power against the onslaught of the undead hordes.

boardgame.name: Glorantha: The Gods War – Buildings
boardgame.description:
Set of 73 buildings to replace basic cardboard components inside core game and Empire expansion.
This brings plastic Shrines, Temples and Ziggurats for all factions plus Castles and Towers for Invisible God.

boardgame.name: Revive
boardgame.description:
Revive civilization, 5000 years after everything was destroyed. Explore the frosted lands and harness its resources. Recruit local inhabitants to your tribe. Build factories and machines, and revive lost locations and relearn your tribe's forgotten abilities.

--

"Revive" is a civilization game for 1-5 players with no fighting or direct conflict. Each player plays one of 6 unique tribes, each with their own abilities, technologies and goals. The game has quick rounds, but lots of possible strategies.

Each player builds their own deck of multi-use cards, representing your citizens. On your turn, you play two cards. Each card can be played in one of several slots around your player board, either to produce resources or to use the citizen's special ability.

You can upgrade and customize each of your slots to improve the effect of the cards played there.

Some cards allow you to explore new lands, build factories, or revive ancient locations:

Exploring lands reveal new territories.

Building factories harness the power of the surrounding terrains, advancing your technologies in three different categories. As you advance on the three technology paths, you unlock machines that can be used for various effects.

Reviving ancient locations is one of the main goals in the game. When you revive a location, you relearn one of your tribe's abilities, and gain knowledge that can be used to power your machines. Reviving the largest locations provide a lot of points, but each location require that you meet certain criteria. These requirements are randomized and function as goals you need to work towards during the game.

The game ends when a certain number of score tiles have been claimed. Score tiles are mainly claimed by reviving major locations, but also by building factories, exploring lands, or completing your tribe's unique mission.

boardgame.name: Monopoly Deal
boardgame.description:
"Everything great about MONOPOLY, now a fast paced, delightfully addictive card game!
Compete online against your friends or the community in this frantic card-game: steal sets of cards, collect debts and be the first to collect three complete property sets of different colors. Build your real estate empire in a new and faster way!
Keeps everything you love about MONOPOLY but packs it into a fast burst of fun."

Source: [Microsoft Store The Game Website].

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Bio Printing Facility Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo card for Terraforming Mars, available at the Fryxgames webshop.

Bio Printing Facility

Introducing new species on demand.

Action: Spend 2 energy to gain 2 plants OR to add 1 animal to ANOTHER card.

Promo card X36

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.
Brand new unused.

English edition
Payment with Paypal or European Bank transfer (IBAN)

boardgame.name: Pax Negotium
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A single-page PocketMod Troika! sphere, made for the #troikaspherejam.

Visit the fabulous corporate owned sphere of Negotium, settled by the all-powerful Consortium. Settle in to your Director-assigned role and pitch in to help the colony.

There's lots to do for the industrious worker:

- Climb the corporate ladder!
- Hunt exotic wildlife!
- Meet powerful robots!
- Find a last-ditch way to thaw out our scientists from their decades long cryo-suspension so that they can determine the source of our cascading nutritional deficiencies and avert the complete collapse of the colony!

Peace and prosperity await!

boardgame.name: The Score: Gratitude Day
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Brightstone’s citizens wait all year for Gratitude Day. Doskvol treats the holiday as a riotous celebration of life, far from its dreary Imperial roots. Thronged masses gather in Unity Park to stuff themselves at the public feast tables, and petit-bourgeois shoppers come to blows over discounted luxury goods at shops across the district.  The capstone of the festival is the Procession of Gratitude - a riotous parade leading to the Church of the Ecstasy of the Flesh's Sanctorium.

With Brightstone’s finest distracted by the parade, your crew snuck into the winding catacombs beneath the Sanctorium. Unfortunately, getting out with your score won't be so easy. If you can fight your way back to the surface and past the revelry of the Procession, you’ll have a lot to be grateful for.

Gratitude Day is a score for Blades in the Dark. It can be used as a one-shot for a holiday game, or as an alternate starting scenario for a more spiritually inclined crew.

boardgame.name: The Magnate
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Magnate is a custom playbook for Blades in the Dark by John Harper, designed for the Unusual Suspects Jam.

A Magnate focuses on using their wealth and authority to force others to do their dirty work. They balance on the knife-edge between the underworld and legitimate business, and always manage to walk away from a job with their hands clean.

Touchstones include V.M. Varga from Fargo, Leviticus Cornwall from Red Dead Redemption 2, Tony Soprano, and all the historical robber barons who broke the rules in the name of industry.

boardgame.name: Beyond Humanity: Astrogórnicy
Beyond Humanity: Astrominers
boardgame.description:
“Beyond Humanity: Astrominers” is a board game for 2 to 4 players (up to 6 with an expansion) in which players manage competing groups of space miners extracting minerals from the asteroid belt. The challenge comes in planning how to manage your personnel and resources through a variety of missions to extract minerals and outmaneuver the competition. Build the wealth of your Corporation, and fuel financial and material success. Be careful to not be left behind, for to the victor go the spoils.

According to the current scientific knowledge of potential space mining missions, players extract seven resources: Water, Xenon, Plasteel, Tungsten, Nickel, Palladium, and Gold, on three different types of asteroids: S-Type, C-Type, and M-Type.

The game uses a collection of custom six-sided dice (7 for each player) with icons representing four types of workers: miners, automatons, geologists and inspectors.
Workers availability is determined by the dice rolls each round, and a skillful management of those worker dice is necessary for effective resource extraction. Players draw Mission cards to their hand and then perform the Missions by placing the Mission card on the Mining Barge in the Dock and gradually filling its fields with worker dice. Order cards are first drawn to the player hand by placing a die with a geologist icon on the Refinery field, and then redeemed at the end of the round by paying the cost indicated on it to receive the victory points marked on the card. In addition, the game features a resource exchange, an Achievement set collection and a set of Executive Cards, providing more possible actions and ways to victory.
Orders, Missions, Achievements, and gathered resources are the means to collect Victory Points.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Tolerance
boardgame.description:
Tolerance is a 3-6 players asymmetric trick-taking game telling a story of three regencies during the turbulent time of 16th century England, when Christianity lived in division and strife. Every player assumes a unique character, with their own motivations and scoring goals. Tolerance is played over three hands of sixteen cards per player, one card per player on every trick. After each hand, there is a scoring phase and then the next regency begins with evolving rules. Players familiar with the game can play with hidden identities to incorporate deduction, adding anxiety in the darkly thematic mood.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Forest Guardian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In The Forest Guardian, a group of level 5 adventurers takes on a mission to investigate the nearby forest after the locally known protector of the woods has turned to evil. A magical deer-shaped phantasmal fey entity from the Fey world has been seen aiding a group of orcs who've failed to conquer the forest on several occasions. The adventurers must retrieve a powerful artifact that can help diminish the spirit's power. In the end, a group of fairies comes to bargain with the heroes and offer a deal that does not appear to have a good outcome.

This fairy-tale-like story does not have a happy ending. Regardless of the adventurers' actions, the balance of power in the great forest is sure to change soon, and not for the better.

boardgame.name: Xenobiology
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zoology Goes Out of This World!

Get new options for your Starfinder explorers of the wild things of the universe, discovering new species and how to interact with them and unravel the secrets of life. Master life sciences with the bioengineer and exostentialist archetypes, with class features like reckless experimentation, psychic backlash, perfect companion evolution, and aberrant companion, plus two sample aberrant companions to follow your hero back home from the lab and go with them on their adventures!

boardgame.name: Cantaloop: Prequel
Cantaloop: Vorgeschichte
boardgame.description:
This tells the back story of our interactive adventure book series, Cantaloop. In this series of games, you will be talking to characters, combining items to solve puzzles and exploring a unique world to get ahead in the story, just like in a classic point-and-click adventure for the computer.

The prequel print & play is a standalone short story in the "Cantaloop" universe. It lets you experience the story before "Cantaloop - Book 1: Breaking into prison" and how Hook ended up in such a situation. Additionally it already teaches you the basics (and some advance mechanics) you will need to play "Cantaloop".

You can choose from two different versions: the "clear text" version and the "hidden text" version. The latter is the original "Cantaloop" experience, where all the text you shouldn't see from the beginning is covered with colored scramble text. As a result you will need to use a red foil to read the text --- and your printer is probably going to request new color cartridges afterwards.

There is also "clear text" version. In this version all text is readable right from the beginning and you should try to not read anything by accident, as this would include potential spoilers.

—description from publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Modiphia (Issue #5 - Q1 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Check out all the latest products, exclusive deals and articles on your favourite Modiphius games! In this issue you’ll find:

A look at the new terrifying dragon, Mirmulnir, for Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms.
A dive into the upcoming Fallout 2d20 RPG
Find out about the The Spy Game by BlackCatsGaming, newly releasing through the VIA Modiphius scheme.
A look at Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20’s nefarious new magic system.
Dune: Walking Without Rhythm
Plus an exciting line up of newly released and upcoming products!
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Spy Game: Roleplaying in a Covert World

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #27 - Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #27:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages

Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property

Bexim's Bulletin Board 1 - printable prop

Bexim's Bulletin Board 2 - printable prop


The Skirmish Table Pages

Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Relicblade Scenario - The Beast

Frostgrave Scenario - The Flooded Cemetery

Frank's Orbital Garage - Monthly Ship File

Drowned Earth Scenario - Phase 3

CORE SPACE - New Trader Card


GM Resources Pages

Spell Discussion 1 - Darkness

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages

Grimdark Refinery Part 2 - Craft Tutorial

Halls of the Mountain King - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - monthy comic strip

boardgame.name: Shadowed Borderland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the shadowed borderlands in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Personal Temporal Pod
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are hired by one of the most important multinationals of your time to find stolen objects.
Easy work.
But when the items in question turn out to be tiny time-machines never-released, you realize the job might take a little longer...

Every Monday, discover a new monster and its quick plot-hook : a psychic parasite, a cursed item, a monstrous insect....

"Monsters of the Week" is a series of scenario, quick to read and to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.

Contains

a quick-to-read plot-hook,
exclusive illustration for the monster,
a description of the creature.


Vous êtes embauché par une des plus importantes multinationales de votre époque pour retrouver des objets volés.
Un travail simple.
Mais lorsque les objets en question s’avèrent être des mini-machines à voyager dans le temps jamais commercialisées, vous vous rendez compte que le travail risque de prendre un peu plus de temps...

Chaque semaine, découvrez un nouveau monstre accompagnez de son amorce de scénario : un parasite psychique, un objet maudit, un insecte monstrueux...
"Monsters of the Week" est une série de scénarios rapide à lire et à incorporer dans vos soirées de jeux, que ce soit pour compléter une campagne, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrits pour un système ou un univers en particulier afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les développer à volonté.

Contient :

une amorce de scénario rapide à lire,
une illustration exclusive du monstre,
une description de la créature.

boardgame.name: Spectacular Settings: The Bullseye
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bullseye sells the highest quality arrows anywhere in the realm, but it is so much more than a fletcher. This 10-page full-color supplement is bursting with new archery content for Fifth Edition, including 18 magical arrows and two new items (fletcher's tools and Quiver of Speed), rules for commissioning weapons, guidance for running archery competitions including five NPC archers, and a new character background, the Competitive Archer, and much more. This bundle also includes two 5k resolution battlemaps (grid and no grid) that are ideal for VTT. Artwork by Dean Spencer, Pawel Parol, and Shane Collins.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Forgotten
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something evil lurks within a forgotten jungle temple, corrupting the very plants and animals that dwell there. Lead by acolyte with a hidden agenda, if the party can survive the temple's traps, parasitic lichen, mind-controlled giant beetles, and a confrontation with the spirit of a dead Dryad, the party may be rewarded with ancient treasure - if they're clever enough to find it. Tomb of the Forgotten is a fresh take on the classic dungeon crawl designed for a 1st level party. Featuring art from Paweł Parol, Dean Spencer, Rob Greyvenstein, and Shane Collins.

12 Page 5e Adventure for a 1st level party
Loaded with full-color artwork
3 Original Monsters with artwork
An Interesting NPC with artwork
A New Potion to delight players
5 High Resolution battlemaps of the Jungle Temple (Day, Night, Grid, No Grid, and Traps Revealed) ideal for VTT
7 Hexplorer Map Tiles to create a regional area for hex-crawl campaigns
Plug-and-play design to make dropping the adventure into your campaign as easy as possible with minimal prep

boardgame.name: The Cook at the Crossroads (AtDM)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Soup's On!

You find yourself at a quaint and idyllic inn. The sights and smells are all perfect to rest your weary bones. But the hairs on the back of your neck stand on end as your sixth-sense tells you something is wrong.

The Cook at the Crossroads is a drop-in adventure that can be used in any Against the Darkmaster campaign or as a one-shot. Depending on playstyle this adventure should last anywhere from 2-3 hours.

The Cook at the Crossroads includes:

An open ended adventure scenario that allows the players freedom to do as they wish.
A fantasy-horror scenario suitable for Against the Darkmaster
A mystery to be solved.
A horrible fate worse than death.

boardgame.name: Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World Needs Heroes!

Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition includes everything you need to create unique superheroes and play exciting stories right out of comic books and movies. Within these pages you’ll find countless powers and power options, extensive rules for gear, vehicles, and even headquarters, a massive assortment of animals and non-player characters, and extensive guidance to help gamemasters run the most engaging superhero games possible. Last but not least, this book includes 38 ready-to-play characters, heroes and villains.

Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition was designed to be highly flexible, allowing you to play anything from street-level vigilantes to high-flying paragons with godlike abilities; from gritty hard-boiled detective stories to four-color cartoon adventures. This edition expands the original to allow for many more options while also streamlining the rules and making the game even faster and easier to run. Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition is the only roleplaying game you need to run any kind of superhero adventure you can imagine.

In 2013, when the world needed heroes, you answered the call. You and your allies were all that stood between light and darkness, good and evil, right and wrong. You fought valiantly and sacrificed dearly. And you saved the day. But ignorance, greed, and tyranny never sleep. Once again, the world is in peril, Hero. Once again, the world needs you to…

TAKE A STAND! JOINT THE FIGHT! BE A HERO!

Evolved from 2013's beloved Prowlers & Paragons game (found on several Top Ten lists of supers games), Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition is Len Pimentel's (Hughesville High, TNT, Six-Gun Fury) masterwork, with extensive design support from Sean Patrick Fannon (Freedom Squadron, Savage Rifts, High Tech Enemies, The Mutant File). The two of them love superhero gaming, and you will love what they've done with this system.

THE BASICS: Roll a handful of six-siders, count the evens (6s count double!), and describe a comic panel or cinematic moment that puts your friends in the scene.

P&PUE features:

Easy, intuitive game mechanics with just enough crunch to be truly fun to play!
Player-empowering narrative and shared descriptive experiences reflecting the best of 21st Century game design!
Fast and fun, character creation allows any concept you can imagine, any power set you might wish to play with.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Hardcover Full Color Ultimate Edition POD Version

boardgame.name: Magical Beasts & Climactic Encounters
Spheres Bestiary: Magical Beasts and Climactic Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wonderful, wild, and great creatures that lurk just under the waves, just beyond the next dune, slumber deep in the forests, or high above in the clouds. Magical beasts are a diverse and unique mainstay for any setting or world.

From the small to large, this book contains a wide variety of new magical beasts. From tremorlizards scrabbling inside of great caves, to hourglass jian cranes maintaining their tranquil homes, to the humble lava toad and the aggressive and territorial behir or remorhaz. Creature variants of unique owlbears which live in snowy mountains and dark forests, great and massive metallic tortoises, and the air and seaborne cousins to the unicorn.

In addition to new creatures, climactic encounters are a wide set of guidelines for creating cinematic and memorable encounters, adding powerful one-time actions, arena actions, or even additional initiatives to diversify Pathfinder “boss” fight execution. Alongside new creatures are new companions and familiars, including new magical beast companions and improved familiars, as well as ways to add templates to old companions to allow them to align with the planes, elements, become mechanical, giant, or even possessed.

Spheres Bestiary: Magical Beasts and Climactic Encounters is a Pathfinder 1st edition supplement and companion to the Beast Tamer’s Handbook using Ultimate Spheres of Power, as well as materials from Spheres of Might, Champions of the Spheres, and other Drop Dead Studio products.

boardgame.name: Country Meat-Grinder Classics: "The Hellson Horror"
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In the past, the Hellsons were good charitable folk, feedin' the hungry and shelterin' the poor at their homestead. They say a witch done hexed 'em for it, and now nobody goes there anymores. They even say weird critters done been seen lurkin' in the woods near their farm. And now, folks're startin' to turn up missin'. It jest may be time to pay the Hellsons a visit..."

Country Meat-Grinder Classics is inspired by the grindhouse horror “hicksploitation” films of the 1970s and 1980s! With a few tweaks to genre details, this horrific backwoods adventure can be used in any number of ways in your own DCC RPG games: these townsfolk could easily be found nestled in DCC’s Shudder Mountains or possibly along one of the trails of Weird Frontiers. The denizens within wouldn’t even be out of place in the post-apocalyptic future of MCC’s Terra AD!

Country Meat-Grinder Classics: "The Hellson Horror" is a 2nd-level adventure for the 4-6 players. This product is compatible with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role-Playing Game (DCC RPG).
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Zombie World Order
boardgame.description:
ZWO is a two-player competitive TCG. Players take on the role as one of the few survivors in a zombie-infested world. Use magic to summon zombies! The game system revolves around revival and toughness! With the toughness to survive whatever is dished out, and revival to bring cards back from the dead, the fun never dies! Battle it out with zombie minions: it’s a fight to the undeath!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wallet Monsters
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A business card monster generator for the Pleasure-not-Business Card RPG Jam.

boardgame.name: The Case: A Lovecraftian Journaling Game
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Case is a solo-rpg journaling game, where the player takes on the role of the Detective, investing a mysterious death. As the story progresses, strange events intrude on the Detective's life, causing them to gradually lose themselves to horror.

Using a deck of cards, a stack of sticky-notes and a notebook and pen, you will play through a series of prompts.
boardgame.rpg: The Case: A Lovecraftian Journaling Game

boardgame.name: BatKrun: Alons bat'karé La Réunion
boardgame.description:
BatKrun is the contraction of the Creole word “Bat’Karé” (to walk) and Run (short for Réunion) and can be translated as “Alons bat’karé La Réunion”.
This game, which received the Innovation Award from the Technopole de La Réunion in 2015, offers its players a real immersion in the daily life of Reunion Island, with its traditions, its living together, its magnificent landscapes and is intended for all lovers of Reunion.

The goal of the game is to obtain the famous title of Ambassador of Reunion by gathering the 5 Ambassador cards of the 5 zones of the game: North, East, South, West and Les Hauts.

Gameplay: the player, called BatKareur, must travel through all the municipalities of the island, answer questions about Reunion, live endemic adventures, attack his opponents and protect himself from their attacks in order to become Ambassador of Reunion.
